snippet: After reports of rioting, terrorism and deadly police shootings, tourism has plummeted in Xinjiang, long considered one of China’s most exotic destinations.
abstract: Reports of rioting, terrorism and deadly police shootings have stopped tourists from traveling to Xinjiang, long considered one of China’s most exotic destinations; revenue from domestic tourism has fallen nearly 6 percent in first half of 2014, compared to same period in 2013, to $3.5 billion; foreign tourism revenue has dropped 1 percent, to $161 million.

byline.contributor: Mia Li contributed research from Kanas Lake, and Patrick Zuo and Becky Davis from Beijing.

lead_paragraph: After reports of rioting, terrorism and deadly police shootings, tourism has plummeted in Xinjiang, long considered one of China’s most exotic destinations.

headline.main: Once a Draw, Restive Region in China Suffers After Unrest
headline.print_headline: Once a Draw, a Tense Region in China Suffers After Unrest
